org.jetel.graph.runtime.jmx

Interface PortTracking

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InputPortTracking, OutputPortTracking
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InputPortTrackingDetail, OutputPortTrackingDetail, PortTrackingDetail

    public interface PortTracking
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface for the tracking information about component's port. This interface should be used by JMX clients. Each change of this interface (rename, delete or add of an attribute) should be reflected in TrackingMetadataToolkit class.
    Since:
    May 14, 2009

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PortTracking.PortType
      Enumeration of port types - input and output type.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentNodeTracking

        NodeTracking getParentNodeTracking()
        Returns:
        tracking of the port's node.

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Returns:
        index of the port in the node.

      • getType

        PortTracking.PortType getType()
        Returns:
        port type, value is either "Input" or "Output".

      • getByteFlow

        int getByteFlow()
        Returns:
        current byte flow.

      • getBytePeak

        int getBytePeak()
        Returns:
        maximum byte flow.

      • getTotalBytes

        long getTotalBytes()
        Returns:
        total byte flow.

      • getRecordFlow

        int getRecordFlow()
        Returns:
        current record flow.

      • getRecordPeak

        int getRecordPeak()
        Returns:
        maximum record flow.

      • getTotalRecords

        long getTotalRecords()
        Returns:
        total record flow.

      • getWaitingRecords

        int getWaitingRecords()
        Returns:
        current record waiting for processing (cached).

      • getAverageWaitingRecords

        int getAverageWaitingRecords()
        Returns:
        average waiting records.

      • getUsedMemory

        int getUsedMemory()
        Returns:
        size of memory footprint in bytes of attached edge (both ports of an edge return same number) - not guaranteed

      • getRemoteRunId

        long getRemoteRunId()
        Returns:
        null for regular edges; remote edges return run identifier of graph on the opposite side of the attached edge
